ygData.messageBody:
On Thu, 30 Mar 2000, Benjamin Jerrad Segal wrote:
> On Wed, 29 Mar 2000 kim@... wrote:
>
> > Quickness is only 80 mana. For a L50 enchanter grouped with
> > all-tanks, giving the entire group Quickness represents only
> > 400 mana, or about a bubble. They can med that back in a
> > little over a minute. Dunno how long it lasts at L50.
>
> SOP for enchanters on CT is to buff with Augmentation, as it lasts about
> as long as clarity, regens stamina faster (great in Kedge), and gives a
> minor stat increase (I believe it was to agility and AC, although the
> former might instigate the latter).

Based on my timings of augmentation and quickness (which agree
with the info in the spdata.eff file and on castersrealm),
Quickness is a 30% speedup, while augmentation is a 15%
speedup. Being a bard, the primary use I see for augmentation
is to regenerate stamina, or relieve me from having to keep up
an attack buff. I would not use it as a general-purpose
speedup unless the stuff you are fighting is low blue.
